title: Biosample
comment: For cultured samples this object represents unique growths or culture harvests.

post_synchronization_time_units.comment: Biosample with a specified post_synchronization_units requires post_synchronization_time specification and specification of the model organism synchronization stage.

post_treatment_time.comment: Biosample with a specified post_treatment_time requires non-empty treatments list and post_treatment_time_units specification.

post_treatment_time_units.comment: Biosample with a specified post_treatment_time_units requires non-empty treatments list post_treatment_time specification.

post_differentiation_time.comment: Biosample with a specified post_differentiation_time requires post_differentiation_time_units specification.

post_differentiation_time_units.comment: Biosample with a specified post_differentiation_time_units requires post_differentiation_time specification.

post_nucleic_acid_delivery_time.comment: Biosample with a specified post_nucleic_acid_delivery_time requires post_nucleic_acid_delivery_time_units specification.

post_nucleic_acid_delivery_time_units.comment: Biosample with a specified post_nucleic_acid_delivery_time_units requires post_nucleic_acid_delivery_time specification.

pooled_from.comment: Biosample with a specified pooled_from list requires at least two entries in the list.

starting_amount.comment: Biosamples with a specified starting_amount require starting_amount_units to also be specified.

starting_amount_units.comment: Biosamples with a specified starting_amount_units require starting_amount to also be specified.

PMI.comment: Tissue biosamples with a specified PMI require PMI_units to also be specified.

PMI_units.comment: Tissue biosamples with a specified PMI_units require PMI to also be specified.

model_organism_age_units.comment: Biosample with a specified model_organism_age_units requires model_organism_age specification.

model_organism_age.comment: Biosample with a specified model_organism_age requires model_organism_age_units specification.

model_organism_mating_status.comment: Biosample with a specified model_organism_mating_status requires model_organism_sex specification.

organism.comment: Human biosamples are not allowed to have model organism properties, and biosample_ontology classification should be different from whole organisms.

post_synchronization_time.comment: Human and mouse biosamples are not allowed to have post_synchronization_time property. Biosample with a specified post_synchronization_time requires post_synchronization_time_units specification and model organism synchronization stage.

fly_life_stage.comment: Only fly biosamples are allowed to have fly_life_stage property.

fly_synchronization_stage.comment: Only fly biosamples are allowed to have fly_synchronization_stage property.

worm_synchronization_stage.comment: Only roundworm biosamples are allowed to have worm_synchronization_stage property.

worm_life_stage.comment: Only roundworm biosamples are allowed to have worm_life_stage property.

mouse_life_stage.comment: Only mouse biosamples are allowed to have mouse_life_stage property.

allOf.comment: Only human biosamples can specify the age it was collected.

sample_collection_age_units.comment: Age units is required if age is specified as anything but unknown.

pulse_chase_time.comment: Biosamples with a specified pulse_chase_time require pulse_chase_time_units to also be specified.

pulse_chase_time_units.comment: Biosamples with a specified pulse_chase_time_units require pulse_chase_time to also be specified.

expressed_genes.comment: Biosamples with an entry in expressed_genes must have the cell_isolation_method of fluorescence activated cell sorting.

uuid.title: UUID
uuid.description: The unique identifier associated with every object.
uuid.comment: Do not submit. The uuid is set by the server.

accession.title: Accession
accession.description: A unique identifier to be used to reference the object prefixed with ENC.
accession.comment: Do not submit. The accession is assigned by the server.

url.title: URL
url.description: An external resource with additional information.

aliases.title: Aliases
aliases.description: Lab specific identifiers to reference an object.
aliases.comment: The purpose of this field is to provide a link into the lab LIMS and to facilitate shared objects.

items.title: Lab alias
items.description: A lab specific identifier to reference an object.
items.comment: Current convention is colon separated lab name and lab identifier. (e.g. john-doe:42).

schema_version.title: Schema version
schema_version.description: The version of the JSON schema that the server uses to validate the object.
schema_version.comment: Do not submit. The version used to validate the object is set by the server. The default should be set to the current version.

status.title: Status
status.description: The status of the metadata object.
status.comment: Do not submit.  This is set by admins along the process of metadata submission.

lab.title: Lab
lab.comment: Required. See lab.json for list of available identifiers.

award.title: Award
award.comment: Required. See award.json for list of available identifiers.

date_created.title: Date created
date_created.description: The date the object was created.
date_created.comment: Do not submit. The date the object is created is assigned by the server.

submitted_by.title: Submitted by
submitted_by.comment: Do not submit. The user that created the object is assigned by the server.

notes.title: Notes
notes.comment: Do not submit. A place for the DCC to keep information that does not have a place in the schema.

submitter_comment.title: Submitter comment
submitter_comment.description: Additional information specified by the submitter to be displayed as a comment on the portal.

documents.title: Documents
documents.description: Documents that describe the biosample preparation.

items.title: Document
items.description: A document that provides additional information (not data file).

references.title: References
references.description: The publications that provide more information about the object.

items.title: Reference
items.description: A publication that provide smore information about the object.

lot_id.title: Lot ID
lot_id.description: The lot identifier provided by the originating lab or vendor.

product_id.title: Product ID
product_id.description: The product identifier provided by the originating lab or vendor.

biosample_ontology.title: Biosample ontology
biosample_ontology.description: An embeded property for linking to biosample type which describes the ontology of the biosample.

genetic_modifications.title: Genetic modifications
genetic_modifications.description: Genetic modification(s). Any genetic alteration of a biosample or donor.
genetic_modifications.comment: Constructs, TALENs, and RNAi objects have been migrated to the GeneticModification object.

alternate_accessions.title: Alternate accessions
alternate_accessions.description: Accessions previously assigned to objects that have been merged with this object.
alternate_accessions.comment: Do not submit. Only admins are allowed to set or update this value.

items.title: Alternate Accession
items.description: An accession previously assigned to an object that has been merged with this object.
items.comment: Only accessions of objects that have status equal replaced will work here.

description.title: Description
description.description: A plain text description of the biosample. Do not include experiment details, genetic modifications or treatments.
description.comment: Free text description of the biosample, do not mix with biosample summary that is calculated and controlled.

elasticsearch_mapping_index_type.title: Field mapping index type
elasticsearch_mapping_index_type.description: Defines one of three types of indexing available

treatments.title: Treatments
treatments.description: A list of treatments applied to the biosample.
treatments.comment: A list of treatments applied to the biosample, it is required to be non-empty if post_treatment_time or post_treatment_time_units are specified.

dbxrefs.title: External resources
dbxrefs.description: Biosample identifiers from external resources, such as Biosample database or Cellosaurus.
dbxrefs.comment: Do not submit. DCC personnel is responsible for submission of biosample external resource identifiers.

donor.title: Donor
donor.description: The donor or strain the biosample was originated from.
donor.comment: For human biosamples, see human_donor.json for available identifiers. For mouse biosamples, see mouse_donor.json for available identifiers. For worm biosamples, see worm_donor.json for available identifiers. For fly biosamples, see fly_donor.json for available identifiers. For manatee biosamples, see manatee_donor.json for available identifiers.

organism.title: Organism
organism.description: The organism the biosample was originated from.

sample_collection_age.title: Sample collection age
sample_collection_age.description: The age or age range of the donor when the biosample was collected.
sample_collection_age.comment: This is designed specifically for cases where more than one biosamples are collected from the same human donor at different ages. Otherwise, you can considering using the age property of human donor.

passage_number.title: Passage number
passage_number.description: Number of passages including the passages from the source.
passage_number.comment: In calculating passage number, include passages from the source.

depleted_in_term_name.title: Depleted in term
depleted_in_term_name.description: UBERON (Uber Anatomy Ontology) term best matching the tissue(s)/body part(s) that were removed from the biosample.

model_organism_mating_status.title: Model organism mating status
model_organism_mating_status.description: The mating status of the animal.
model_organism_mating_status.comment: The value is not available for human biosamples.

internal_tags.title: Internal tags
internal_tags.description: Some biosamples are part of particular data collections.
internal_tags.comment: Do not submit. Internal tags are for DCC use only.

originated_from.title: Originated from
originated_from.description: A biosample that the sample was orginated from.

pooled_from.title: Pooled from
pooled_from.description: The biosamples from which aliquots were pooled to form the biosample.
pooled_from.comment: A list of biosamples used to create the biosample, if specified, it requires minimum of two entries.

items.description: A biosample from which an aliquot was taken to form the biosample.

part_of.title: Separated from
part_of.description: A biosample from which a discrete component was taken. That component is this biosample.

host.title: Host biosample
host.description: A biosample that was hosting this biosample.
host.comment: For example a mouse could be a host of bone marrow biosample in case of transplantation. See biosamples.json for available identifiers.

subcellular_fraction_term_name.title: Subcellular fraction
subcellular_fraction_term_name.description: The GO (Gene Ontology) term name for cellular component that constitutes the biosample.

phase.title: Cell cycle phase
phase.description: Specification of cell cycle phase of the biosample.
phase.comment: The phase property should be limited to biosamples with biosample_ontology classification that belongs to [primary cell, cell line, in vitro differentiated cells].

culture_harvest_date.title: Culture harvest date
culture_harvest_date.description: For cultured samples, the date the biosample was taken.
culture_harvest_date.comment: Date should be submitted in as YYYY-MM-DD. The property should be limited to biosamples with biosample_ontology classification that belongs to [primary cell, cell line, in vitro differentiated cells].

culture_start_date.title: Culture start date
culture_start_date.description: For cultured samples, the date the culture was started. For cell lines, the date this particular growth was started, not the date the line was established.
culture_start_date.comment: Date should be submitted in as YYYY-MM-DD. The property should be limited to biosamples with biosample_ontology classification that belongs to [primary cell, cell line, in vitro differentiated cells].

date_obtained.title: Date obtained
date_obtained.description: For tissue samples, the date the biosample was taken.
date_obtained.comment: Date should be submitted in as YYYY-MM-DD.

starting_amount.title: Starting amount
starting_amount.description: The initial quantity of cells, tissue or animals obtained.

starting_amount_units.title: Starting amount units
starting_amount_units.description: The units used to quantify the amount of cells or tissue obtained.

PMI.title: Post-mortem interval
PMI.description: The amount of time elapsed since death.
PMI.comment: Post-mortem interval for tissues should be reported, if known. Using for biosamples other than tissue is currently not allowed.

PMI_units.title: Post-mortem interval units
PMI_units.description: The unit in which the PMI time was reported.
PMI_units.comment: Post-mortem interval units for tissues should be reported with PMI value, if known. Using for biosamples other than tissue is currently not allowed.

preservation_method.title: Preservation method
preservation_method.description: The method by which the sample was preserved: cryopreservation (slow-freeze) or flash-freezing.
preservation_method.comment: Indicate the sample preservation_method if known and may be/become an experimental variable to track.

cell_isolation_method.title: Cell isolation method
cell_isolation_method.description: The method by which the cell(s) in the sample were isolated.
cell_isolation_method.comment: Indicate the method used to isolate cell(s) in the sample. For example Fluidigm C1 cell isolation should specify: microfluidic cell sorting.

model_organism_sex.title: Model organism sex
model_organism_sex.description: The sex of the model organism the biosample comes from.
model_organism_sex.comment: model_organism_sex is not valid for a human biosample.

mouse_life_stage.title: Mouse life stage
mouse_life_stage.description: The life stage of the mouse biosample.
mouse_life_stage.comment: mouse_life_stage is not valid for a human biosample.

fly_life_stage.title: Fly life stage
fly_life_stage.description: Fly development stage of the animals used to prepare the biosample.
fly_life_stage.comment: fly_life_stage is valid only for fly biosamples.

fly_synchronization_stage.title: Fly synchronization stage
fly_synchronization_stage.description: Fly development stage at which flies were synchronized.
fly_synchronization_stage.comment: Stage at which flies were synchronized. If available use in conjunction with time and time units post-synchronization.
enum: puff stage: PS (1-2), dark blue gut
puff stage: PS (3-6), light blue gut

post_synchronization_time.title: Post-synchronization time
post_synchronization_time.description: The time that elapsed past the point when animals were synchronized.
post_synchronization_time.comment: Use in conjunction with fly_synchronization_stage or worm_synchronization_stage to specify time elapsed post-synchronization. It requires specification of post_synchronization_time_units as well.

post_synchronization_time_units.title: Post-synchronization time units
post_synchronization_time_units.description: The units of time that elapsed past the point when animals were synchronized.
post_synchronization_time_units.comment: Use in conjunction with fly_synchronization_stage or worm_synchronization_stage and post_synchronization_time to specify time elapsed post-synchronization.

post_treatment_time.title: Post-treatment time
post_treatment_time.description: The time that elapsed past the point when biosamples were treated.
post_treatment_time.comment: Use in conjunction with treatment and post_treatment_time_units to specify time elapsed post-treatment. post_treatment_time specification requires non-empty treatments list and post_treatment_time_units specification.

post_treatment_time_units.title: Post-treatment time units
post_treatment_time_units.description: The units of time that elapsed past the point when biosamples were treated.
post_treatment_time_units.comment: Use in conjunction with post_treatment_time and treatment to specify time elapsed post-treatment. post_treatment_time_units specification requires non-empty treatments list and post_treatment_time specification.

post_differentiation_time.title: Post-differentiation time
post_differentiation_time.description: The time that elapsed past the point when biosamples were differentiated.
post_differentiation_time.comment: Use in conjunction with post_differentiation_time_units to specify time elapsed post-differentiation. Use of this property requires post_differentiation_time_units specification.

post_differentiation_time_units.title: Post-differentiation time units
post_differentiation_time_units.description: The units of time that elapsed past the point when biosamples were differentiated.
post_differentiation_time_units.comment: Use in conjunction with post_differentiation_time to specify time elapsed post-differentiation. Use of this property requires post_differentiation_time specification.

worm_life_stage.title: Worm life stage
worm_life_stage.description: Worm development stage of the animals used to prepare the biosample.
worm_life_stage.comment: worm_life_stage is valid only for worm biosamples.
enum: mixed stage (late embryonic and L1 larva)

worm_synchronization_stage.title: Worm synchronization stage
worm_synchronization_stage.description: Worm development stage at which the animals were synchronized.
worm_synchronization_stage.comment: Stage at which worms were synchronized. Use in conjunction with time and time units post-synchronization.  worm_life_stage is valid only for worm biosamples.

model_organism_age.title: Age
model_organism_age.description: The age or age range of the model donor organism when biological material was sampled.
model_organism_age.comment: model_organism_age is not valid for a human biosample.

model_organism_age_units.title: Age units
model_organism_age_units.description: Age units of the model organism.
model_organism_age_units.comment: model_organism_age_units are not valid for a human biosample.

model_organism_health_status.title: Model organism health status
model_organism_health_status.description: Health status of the model organism.
model_organism_health_status.comment: model_organism_health_status is not valid for a human biosample.

nih_institutional_certification.title: NIH institutional certification
nih_institutional_certification.description: Institutional certification given by the NIH for human biosamples.

post_nucleic_acid_delivery_time.title: Post-nucleic acid delivery time
post_nucleic_acid_delivery_time.description: The time that elapsed past the point when nucleic acid was introduced into the biosample.
post_nucleic_acid_delivery_time.comment: Use in conjunction with post_nucleic_acid_delivery_time_units to specify time elapsed post-nucleic acid delivery. Use of this property requires post_nucleic_acid_delivery_time_units specification.

post_nucleic_acid_delivery_time_units.title: Post-nucleic acid delivery time units
post_nucleic_acid_delivery_time_units.description: The units of time that elapsed past the point when nucleic acid was introduced into the biosample.
post_nucleic_acid_delivery_time_units.comment: Use in conjunction with post_nucleic_acid_delivery_time to specify time elapsed post-nucleic acid delivery. Use of this property requires post_nucleic_acid_delivery_time specification.

disease_term_id.title: Disease ontology IDs
disease_term_id.description: Ontology identifiers describing the disease(s) affecting the biosample.

items.title: Disease ontology ID
items.description: Ontology identifier describing the disease affecting the biosample.

pulse_chase_time.title: Pulse-chase time
pulse_chase_time.description: The time that elapsed in the chase phase of a pulse-chase experiment.
pulse_chase_time.comment: Use in conjunction with pulse_chase_time_units to specify time elapsed in the chase phase of a pulse-chase experiment. Use of this property requires pulse_chase_time_units specification.

pulse_chase_time_units.title: Pulse-chase time units
pulse_chase_time_units.description: The units of time that elapsed in the chase phase of a pulse-chase experiment.
pulse_chase_time_units.comment: Use in conjunction with pulse_chase_time and treatment to specify time elapsed in the chase phase of a pulse-chase experiment. Use of this property requires pulse_chase_time specification.

expressed_genes.title: Expressed genes
expressed_genes.description: Gene expression selected for in the biosample by sorting.
expressed_genes.comment: Use in conjunction with fluorescence activated cell sorting in cell_isolation_method to specify the gene cells are sorted on.

items.title: Locus
items.description: The gene expression that fluorescence activated cell sorting of the biosample is based upon.

expression_percentile.title: Gene expression percentile
expression_percentile.description: Gene expression read-out expressed as a percentile.

expression_range_minimum.title: Gene expression range minimum
expression_range_minimum.description: Gene expression read-out range minimum percentage value.

expression_range_maximum.title: Gene expression range maximum
expression_range_maximum.description: Gene expression read-out range maximum percentage value.

disease_term_name.title: Disease term names
disease_term_name.description: Ontology term(s) describing the disease affecting the biosample.

items.title: Disease term name
items.description: Ontology term describing the disease affecting the biosample.

model_organism_donor_modifications.title: Model organism genetic modifications
model_organism_donor_modifications.description: Genetic modifications made in the model organism of the biosample.

items.title: Model organism genetic modification
items.description: Genetic modification made in the model organism of the biosample.

applied_modifications.title: Applied modifications
applied_modifications.description: All genetic modifications made in either the model organism and/or biosample.

items.title: Applied modification
items.description: Genetic modification made in either the model organism and/or biosample.

parent_of.description: The biosample(s) that have this biosample in their part_of property.
parent_of.comment: Do not submit. Values in the list are reverse links of a biosamples that are part_of this biosample.
parent_of.title: Child biosamples

origin_batch.title: Origin batch
origin_batch.description: Biosample @id representing the origin batch the biosample was obtained from

perturbed.title: Perturbed
perturbed.description: A flag to indicate whether the biosample has been perturbed with a treatment or genetic modification.
